results:
Based on the search results, I found valuable information about the chronological history of Polish translations of Aldous Huxley's "Brave New World," particularly involving the translators Stanisława Kuszelewska and Bogdan Baran, and the publisher Wydawnictwo Rój. Here's what the search revealed:

## Chronological History of Polish Translations:

The first Polish translation was published by Rój in 1933, translated by Stanisława Kuszelewska with the title "Nowy, wspaniały świat."

A second edition by Stanisława Kuszelewska was published by Rój in 1935, titled "Nowy wspaniały świat."

Stanisława Kuszelewska's translation was republished in 1985 by Oficyna Liberałów.

Bogdan Baran's translation was published in 1988 by Wydawnictwo Literackie in Kraków.

There is also mention of an unpublished manuscript translation by Krzysztof Hejwowski.

## Academic Analysis:

The paper analyzes selected aspects of the retranslations of A. Huxley's Brave New World in Poland, applying theoretical approaches to retranslations to the new (unpublished) translation of Aldous Huxley's Brave New World by Krzysztof Hejwowski in the context of his earlier criticism of the translations by Stanisława Kuszelewska and Bogdan Baran.

The search results indicate this is an active area of academic research, with scholarly work published on "Nowe wspaniałe światy A. Huxleya i ich recepcja w Polsce" by Wydawnictwa Uniwersytetu Warszawskiego in 2019.
